text: hi everyone I'm Brandon West again here
at the MGM Grand where currently we have
the reinvent hackathon for social good
going on with about a hundred and eighty
participants behind us we've had about
30 or so launches in the last two days
it's it's really hard to keep up there's
just a lot of really cool things being
announced I want to quickly tell you
about six of my favorite things that
have launched so far here at reinvent
2018 the first one is the AWS amplified
console so if you're not familiar with
AWS amplify it's a framework for modern
web app development that really makes it
easy to provision back-end services and
connect them to your application so if
you need to create an AWS API gateway so
that people can interact with your app
via the API or maybe you want to use
Amazon kognito for authentication it
makes it really really easy to do that
the AWS amplify console adds continuous
deployment and hosting for these modern
web applications so you can integrate
with github get lab bitbucket or AWS
code commit and so if you're building a
web application that uses react angular
vue.js ionic or ember really any modern
web framework this makes it really
really easy to add continuous deploy and
hosting so when you commit a change to
your git repo ATM AWS amplify console
will detect that change automatically
build it and deploy your changes for
both the back end and the front end
which is really really cool one of my
other favorite services that we've
launched so far is firecracker
firecracker is like micro virtual
machines kernel-based virtual machines
they are already battle tested they
power AWS lambda and they powerf our
gate this is really really a cool
technology that improves performance you
can get cold start times as low as 125
milliseconds and it's great for security
because there's no bios there's very
limited attack vectors another one of my
favorites that we announced today is
Robo maker which is a collection of
tools for building robotics applications
there's a integrated development
environment based on cloud 9 for
building robotics applications there's
extensions for the robot operating
system which is the most widely used
robot creation toolkit and allows you to
easily connect the things you build in
Ross to AWS
for example take video you're capturing
on a robot and pipe it to a Kinesis
video streamer also you can do virtual
world simulation so if you're building a
robot that brings you a cup of coffee
you can simulate that in a 3d
environment and then apply it to the
real world and hopefully the robot will
actually bring you a cup of coffee we
have a new ec2 instance type which is
the c5n which provides a hundred gigabit
of bandwidth which is a lot of bandwidth
I'm trying to think of use cases for
that and I can't think of anything I
could build that would need 100 gigabits
of bandwidth we have another type of ec2
instance which is the a one set of
instances these are built on
custom-designed silicon that we built
in-house they're armed based processors
and these are really really cool because
you can reduce your instantly to
instance costs by up to 45% by using
these arm based processors finally we
have AWS ground station which is really
really cool lets you take data from
space and put it in the cloud we have a
bunch thousands of orbiting satellites
currently that companies that want to
collect data from these satellites have
to build ground stations themselves
these can cost up to a million dollars
per ground station and this is just a
lot of capital expense and overhead to
maintain them we're starting out with
two AWS powered ground stations and
we'll be expanding that up to twelve by
mid 2019 so that's just six of some of
the awesome things we've launched so far
we haven't even really got to the good
stuff yet which will be coming tomorrow
during Andy Jesse's keynote from 8 to 11
a.m. and then Thursday at Verner Vogel's
keynote from 8:30 to 10:30 a.m. so I'm
really really excited we've got robots
we've got space we've got new
custom-designed processors all kinds of
fun things for developers to jump in and
start playing around with on AWS so make
sure you tune into Andy's keynote and
dhavernas keynote I know there's a lot
of things that are being announced you
can check out the what's new feed on the
Amazon blog to keep up with some of
these new announcements and thank you
very much for joining I hope that you
find some of these new services and
features as cool as I do see you soon
